dialogue_history.content:
Analyze this financial news and estimate stock price movement probabilities.
Company: Apple Inc. (AAPL)
News Headline: 'Magnificent 7,' crypto, Trump coin, AI, Trump, tariffs, Fed, and everything else that will dominate Davos
News Content: This is The Takeaway from today's Morning Brief, which you can sign up to receive in your inbox every morning along with:

The chart of the day What we're watching What we're reading Economic data releases and earnings

Coverage of the World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland, each year is something I view as a competitive sport.

I actually start training for the intense week over the summer, as my few close friends know (and yes, they all make fun of me). The number of workouts every week in the lead-up rises incrementally so I can easily sprint up and down the two-mile promenade with a backpack to stuff in as many meetings as humanly possible (yes, I do this).

My one cheat meal a week gets replaced by green drinks and extra doses of vitamins to ensure I don't get sick. I meditate twice a day and carefully pick out clothes I know will help me execute at the highest level. Look good, feel good, good things happen.

To me, this one event is the closest I will get to being like Michael Jordan in the playoffs — and I am very lucky to be in attendance.

And this year, the gathering of the elites flying in on private jets to wax poetic on the world's biggest problems will be extra nutty.

Read more: Here are the biggest global risks for 2025

The conference unofficially kicks off on Trump's Inauguration Day. Some CEOs I know who normally would be at Davos all week are dropping in mid-week after working the inauguration party rounds. By Tuesday, the newly minted president may have uncorked a host of executive orders that could impact the businesses of the top CEOs on the ground. And, of course, impact the global markets.

This is why this year's WEF will be more important than the norm for you, the average investor. The headlines will be coming in hot and heavy as CEOs look to challenge Trump or get on his good side. They will also look to talk up their businesses ahead of the start of earnings season, and with markets getting a little rockier of late.

Here's what yours truly and our very own Jennifer Schonberger will be watching while bundled up in five layers all week. Be sure to bookmark the "streaming now" section on Yahoo Finance to catch all our market-moving interviews in real time. Or tune in where you normally catch us, whether that's on Samsung TV or our nifty app.

Unlike our previous trips to Davos over the past decade, I will be taping several special episodes of the Opening Bid podcast on the ground. I could tell you who those guests will be, but where is the fun in that? Best to be surprised!

Story Continues

Now, on to that guide...

Big bank CEOs: The biggest names in banking, such as JPMorgan (JPM) CEO Jamie Dimon, Bank of America (BAC) CEO Brian Moynihan, Goldman Sachs (GS) CEO David Solomon, Citi (C) CEO Jane Fraser, and Morgan Stanley (MS) CEO Ted Pick will be in attendance. While this group will all get asked about Trump policies, it's going to be their outlook on interest rates that will be most key to market sentiment. Most have not spoken publicly since the Fed signaled a likely halt in rate cuts last month, and they will want to be heard ahead of the Fed's Jan. 28-29 policy meeting.

The tariff CEOs: Retail will have a nice showing at Davos, with the CEOs of Polo Ralph Lauren (RL), Williams Sonoma (WSM), and Gap (GAP) (their CEO's first time at the event) making the rounds. These companies are right in the middle of the tariff debate. I'll be interested in how they are preparing for Trump tariffs from a supply chain perspective. I am also interested in how much they could raise prices post-tariffs — it could offer valuable insight into the 2025 inflation outlook and Fed policy.

Read more: How do tariffs work, and who really pays them?

The race to catch Nvidia: It will be another year of artificial intelligence chatter throughout the halls of Davos. This time, I think the discussions will take two forms. First, unlike last year, where the AI discussions were mostly about potential, investors are going to want to see clear lines to revenue and profits. So I encourage AI CEOs to bring it. And two, we will probably hear more about how Big Tech players in Microsoft (MSFT) and Alphabet (GOOGL) are aiming to develop their own high-powered AI chips to catch Nvidia (NVDA), or at least make good enough chips to diversify. Leaders from OpenAI and Anthropic will also be in attendance, and their thoughts on chips could be key. I'll be watching Nvidia's stock price like a hawk this week, and you should be as well.

Crypto delegation: The crypto industry has had a solid presence at Davos in the past five years. This year, the industry is expected to be out in force, headlined by an appearance from Coinbase (COIN) CEO Brian Armstrong. I'll be quite attuned to what the crypto crowd thinks about the latest volatility in bitcoin, MicroStrategy's (MSTR) bitcoin buying binge, what they are hearing from the pro-crypto Trump administration, and early assessments on Paul Atkins as the likely next SEC chairman.

And of course, the new Trump coin that debuted to much fanfare (and market cap) on Friday.

The token quickly rose to a market cap of $73 billion in about 48 hours, surpassing DOGE as the largest meme coin so far.

The market cap of the crypto has since dropped to $12 billion from its launch, according to CoinMarketCap.

Stocks: Stocks are beginning to look top-heavy (especially the Magnificent 7), as I have reported. I'm eager to hear from market pros such as JPMorgan's Mary Erdoes and economic experts like Nouriel Roubini on whether they are seeing red flags on the horizon. Any calls they make at this Davos may hold greater weight given more volatile market conditions and increased Trump policy uncertainty.

The political wild cards: As of this writing, contacts have told me President-elect Donald Trump plans to send delegates to Davos. Who precisely gets the nod is the wild card. (I fancy it will be potential Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick, a Davos party scene regular for many years. Elon has long hated Davos, so hard to see him appearing). Trump himself is slated to give a speech remotely on Thursday, a source told Yahoo Finance.

But who ultimately shows up from Trump's orbit — and what they say once touching down — could set the tone on US international relations right out of the gate. If a delegate arrives at Davos days after Trump takes actions that could weigh on the economic growth of foreign countries and then aims to explain the actions, best believe the inevitable headlines may not be so market-friendly.

—

Brian Sozzi is Yahoo Finance's Executive Editor. Follow Sozzi on X @BrianSozzi, Instagram, and on LinkedIn. Tips on stories? Email brian.sozzi@yahoofinance.com. Three times each week, Sozzi fields insight-filled conversations with the biggest names in business and markets on Yahoo Finance's Opening Bid podcast. Find more episodes on our video hub. Watch on your preferred streaming service. Or listen and subscribe on Apple Podcasts, Spotify, or wherever you find your favorite podcasts.

Click here for in-depth analysis of the latest stock market news and events moving stock prices

Read the latest financial and business news from Yahoo Finance

View Comments

Next I will provide you some predictions of stock price movement probabilities and the corresponding analysis by others in the previous rounds.
Note that others' predictions may indicate that they have some other information about the stock price. A high prediction may indicate that they have some positive information about the stock, while a low prediction may indicate that they have some megative information about the stock.
Also note that there are multiple rounds of precitions, demonstrating the trend of others' beliefs.
Please take these information into consideration when prediction the stock price movement probabilities.
Previous predictions:
Round: 0
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.25, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.65, Reasoning: The news discusses broader trends and uncertainties at the World Economic Forum, particularly concerning geopolitical risks and corporate sentiment regarding the incoming administration's policies. Specific mentions of interest rates, tariffs, and economic outlooks could potentially sway investor sentiment negatively, particularly for companies perceived to be vulnerable to these factors. Given that AAPL is part of the Magnificent 7 which is described as looking 'top-heavy', there is room for a decline amidst prevailing uncertainties. Thus, there is a moderate probability of a stock price decline associated with this news, while the potential for a rise appears limited due to the overall market sentiment highlighted in the article.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.4, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.6, Reasoning: The news article focuses on the World Economic Forum in Davos and potential market-moving events. While Apple isn't directly mentioned as a key topic, the general market sentiment discussed can influence Apple's stock. The article highlights potential challenges from Trump policies, tariff implications, and the possibility of 'top-heavy' stocks (including the Mag 7, which Apple is a part of). On the other hand, discussions about AI, where Apple is striving to be relevant, and the general optimism that CEOs try to exude before earnings season could be positive. The uncertainty surrounding new Trump policies and the cautious sentiment regarding overvalued stocks suggest a higher probability of a stock price fall in the short term, especially given the reference to 'volatile market conditions'. However, positive AI discussion and CEO optimism may buffer the fall. The article does not contain explicit Apple-specific information that would cause a positive impact. Given these considerations, a slight decline is more likely.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.45, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.45, Reasoning: Jim Cramer's comments are mixed. While he criticizes Zuckerberg's assessment of Apple's post-Jobs innovation, calling it "one of the most offensive interviews I've heard," he doesn't offer a concrete negative outlook on Apple's stock.  The news article focuses more on the California wildfires and their broader economic impact, and on Cramer's discussion of interest rates and the political climate. The mention of Apple is largely in the context of Zuckerberg's criticism, which, while negative, may not significantly impact the stock price given Apple's overall market position and continued profitability.  The article also highlights the large number of hedge funds holding AAPL stock, suggesting sustained institutional confidence. Therefore, the probability of a stock price movement in either direction due *specifically* to this news is relatively low. The dominant factors affecting AAPL are likely to be broader market forces and the company's own performance, rather than this particular news item. 
Model: deepseek/deepseek-chat-v3-0324, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.5, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.5, Reasoning: The news article primarily discusses the World Economic Forum in Davos and its potential impact on various sectors, including technology, banking, retail, and crypto. While Apple Inc. (AAPL) is mentioned as part of the 'Magnificent 7,' the article does not provide specific information or developments directly related to Apple that would significantly influence its stock price. The broader market sentiment discussed (e.g., AI, tariffs, Fed policy) could have indirect effects, but without Apple-specific news, the impact is likely neutral. Therefore, the probabilities of a rise or fall in Apple's stock price due to this news are balanced and low.
Model: meta-llama/llama-4-scout, Prediction of stock price rising: -1, Prediction of stock price falling: -1, Reasoning: Fail to give a prediction. Error Reason: Parse error
Model: meta-llama/llama-3.3-70b-instruct, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.45, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.55, Reasoning: The news article discusses the temporary shutdown of TikTok in the US due to a new law and the potential for President Trump to issue an executive order to extend the period before the law's prohibitions take effect. This situation may impact Apple Inc. (AAPL) as the company's App Store is involved in the distribution of the TikTok app. However, the article also suggests that other companies like Meta (META), Snapchat (SNAP), and Pinterest (PINS) could potentially benefit from a TikTok ban. Given the uncertainty surrounding the situation and the potential for Apple to be affected indirectly, the probability of the stock price rising or falling is difficult to determine with certainty. Nevertheless, since Apple's involvement is more related to the App Store and the company has a diverse range of products and services, the impact on its stock price might be minimal. Therefore, the probabilities are estimated based on the assumption that the news might have a slight negative impact on Apple's stock due to the potential loss of app revenue, but the effect is expected to be limited.
Model: qwen/qwen-turbo, Prediction of stock price rising: -1, Prediction of stock price falling: -1, Reasoning: Fail to give a prediction. Error Reason: Parse error
Round: 1
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.35, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.65, Reasoning: The news discusses the World Economic Forum and the uncertain geopolitical climate surrounding tariffs, economic policies related to the Trump administration, and overall market sentiment, particularly regarding 'top-heavy' stocks. Although Apple is part of the 'Magnificent 7,' which suggests strength, the fear of rising tariffs and interest rates could negatively impact investor sentiment. With concerns about overvaluation in tech stocks and the current volatile market conditions, there is a higher probability of a stock price decline. However, discussions around AI, where Apple is striving to make a strong mark, could provide some positive sentiment, though not enough to offset the broader concerns. Thus, the probabilities lean towards a higher chance of a price decline versus an increase.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.4, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.6, Reasoning: The article discusses the World Economic Forum (WEF) in Davos and potential market-moving events. While Apple (AAPL) is mentioned as part of the 'Magnificent 7' which is beginning to look 'top-heavy', the article offers broader trends and uncertainties. Apple isn't a central topic but the general market sentiment, influenced by potential challenges from Trump policies, tariff implications, and volatile market conditions, can influence Apple if the market has a downturn. However, discussions around AI, in which AAPL seeks to strengthen its position, and positive CEO sentiment might counteract negativity. The previous rounds show a slight inclination towards a fall initially, but there's a slight increase to 'neutral' then back to a fall as the discussion continues. Taking these factors and previous predictions into account, there's still a slightly higher chance of a decrease given the uncertainty flagged in the article and its effect on overall market sentiment, which could impact AAPL.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.55, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.4, Reasoning: The news focuses on Jim Cramer's reaction to Mark Zuckerberg's critical comments about Apple's innovation since Steve Jobs' death.  Cramer finds Zuckerberg's statements highly offensive but doesn't directly predict a negative impact on Apple's stock price.  The article also mentions other significant factors like California wildfires and interest rate hikes, which have broader economic implications potentially overshadowing the impact of Zuckerberg's comments. The previous round's predictions show a range of opinions, highlighting the uncertainty. While Zuckerberg's critique could negatively affect sentiment, Apple's market position and diverse product line likely buffer against a significant drop.  Considering the mixed signals and the influence of broader market factors, the probability of a price rise is slightly higher than a fall due to this specific news item alone.
Model: deepseek/deepseek-chat-v3-0324, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.5, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.5, Reasoning: The news article primarily focuses on the World Economic Forum in Davos and its potential impact on various sectors, including technology, banking, retail, and crypto. While Apple Inc. (AAPL) is mentioned as part of the 'Magnificent 7,' the article does not provide specific information or developments directly related to Apple that would significantly influence its stock price. The broader market sentiment discussed (e.g., AI, tariffs, Fed policy) could have indirect effects, but without Apple-specific news, the impact is likely neutral. Therefore, the probabilities of a rise or fall in Apple's stock price due to this news are balanced and low.
Model: meta-llama/llama-4-scout, Prediction of stock price rising: -1, Prediction of stock price falling: -1, Reasoning: Fail to give a prediction. Error Reason: Parse error
Model: meta-llama/llama-3.3-70b-instruct, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.4, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.6, Reasoning: The news article discusses the temporary shutdown of TikTok in the US and the potential for President Trump to issue an executive order to extend the period before the law's prohibitions take effect. This situation may impact Apple Inc. (AAPL) as the company's App Store is involved in the distribution of the TikTok app. However, the impact on Apple's stock price is expected to be minimal due to the company's diverse range of products and services. The article also suggests that other companies like Meta (META), Snapchat (SNAP), and Pinterest (PINS) could potentially benefit from a TikTok ban. Considering the uncertainty surrounding the situation and the potential for Apple to be affected indirectly, the probability of the stock price rising or falling is difficult to determine with certainty. Nevertheless, since Apple's involvement is more related to the App Store and the company has a diverse range of products and services, the impact on its stock price might be slight and negative due to the potential loss of app revenue.
Model: qwen/qwen-turbo, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.35, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.55, Reasoning: The financial news highlights Louis Navellier's positive view on Apple Inc., placing it among his top long-term stock picks. Navellier's reputation and track record lend credibility to his recommendations. Additionally, Apple's strong financial performance, AI innovations, and environmental initiatives suggest positive fundamentals. However, it currently ranks as the fifth pick in Navellier's list, possibly indicating that others might see higher potential in other stocks. Previous predictions suggest mixed sentiments, with a generally lower probability of stock price increase due to broader market sentiments and uncertainties.
Round: 2
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.3, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.7, Reasoning: The news primarily focuses on the World Economic Forum and the prevailing uncertainties regarding global economic policies, particularly those associated with the incoming Trump administration. Given that Apple Inc. is mentioned as part of the 'Magnificent 7', which appears to be viewed as 'top-heavy', there is a concern that tech stocks—including Apple—might face downward pressure amidst market volatility and fears surrounding tariff impacts and overvaluation. While there are elements of positive sentiment focused on AI discussions where Apple is striving to excel, the overall market environment and potential policy disruptions suggest a higher likelihood of a stock price decline over a rise. Previous predictions have consistently leaned towards a higher probability of falling prices due to these concerns, leading to my estimated probabilities.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.4, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.6, Reasoning: The news article discusses the World Economic Forum (WEF) and its potential market impact. While not directly focused on Apple (AAPL), the piece mentions several factors that could indirectly influence its stock price. Concerns about 'top-heavy' stocks (including the Magnificent 7, of which Apple is a part), uncertainties surrounding Trump's policies and potential tariffs, and volatile market conditions could negatively impact AAPL. However, discussions surrounding AI (in which Apple is trying to strengthen its position) and the optimism CEOs often express before earnings season could provide a buffer. Considering the previous rounds of predictions, which generally leaned towards a slight negative impact or neutrality, I anticipate a slightly negative influence on the stock price given the broader market uncertainties highlighted in the article.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.55, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.45, Reasoning: The news focuses on Jim Cramer's reaction to Mark Zuckerberg's negative comments about Apple's innovation since Steve Jobs' death.  Cramer dismisses Zuckerberg's statement but the sentiment is still somewhat negative. However, the article also broadly discusses California wildfires and interest rate hikes.  These broader economic factors likely overshadow the impact of Zuckerberg's relatively minor criticism of Apple.  Apple's overall market position and financial strength mitigate the potential negative impact of the news.  The previous predictions show a wide range;  The initial negative predictions lean towards a higher probability of a price decline due to the broader market uncertainty. However, subsequent rounds show a shift toward more neutral or even positive sentiment in models such as google/gemini-flash-1.5.  Considering the mixed signals and the influence of broader market factors, and weighing the fact that the Zuckerberg comments are unlikely to be a major driver of Apple's stock price, the probability of a price change in either direction due to this specific news is relatively low.  A slightly higher probability of a price rise is assigned, reflecting the overall strong position of Apple and the relatively minor nature of the negative sentiment expressed.
Model: deepseek/deepseek-chat-v3-0324, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.45, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.45, Reasoning: The news article discusses the World Economic Forum in Davos and its potential impact on various sectors, including technology, banking, retail, and crypto. While Apple Inc. (AAPL) is mentioned as part of the 'Magnificent 7,' the article does not provide specific information or developments directly related to Apple that would significantly influence its stock price. The broader market sentiment discussed (e.g., AI, tariffs, Fed policy) could have indirect effects, but without Apple-specific news, the impact is likely neutral. Previous predictions from other models also indicate a balanced view, with slight variations leaning towards a higher probability of a fall due to broader market uncertainties. Therefore, the probabilities of a rise or fall in Apple's stock price due to this news are balanced and low.
Model: meta-llama/llama-4-scout, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.45, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.55, Reasoning: The news article discusses Warren Buffett's holdings in Dow Jones stocks, highlighting that Apple (AAPL) is Berkshire Hathaway's largest holding. Buffett praised Apple, calling it 'an even better business' than Coca-Cola and American Express. However, the article also mentions that Apple does not offer a significant dividend yield, which might make it less appealing to income investors. Despite this, the overall sentiment from Buffett's praise and the company's strong market position suggests a positive outlook. Considering previous predictions, there is a mixed sentiment but with a slight inclination towards a potential decline due to broader market uncertainties. However, Buffett's endorsement and the company's strong fundamentals could counterbalance this, leading to a slightly higher probability of a stock price rise.
Model: meta-llama/llama-3.3-70b-instruct, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.4, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.6, Reasoning: The news discusses the temporary shutdown of TikTok in the US and the potential for President Trump to issue an executive order to extend the period before the law's prohibitions take effect. This situation may impact Apple Inc. (AAPL) as the company's App Store is involved in the distribution of the TikTok app. However, the impact on Apple's stock price is expected to be minimal due to the company's diverse range of products and services. Other companies like Meta (META), Snapchat (SNAP), and Pinterest (PINS) could potentially benefit from a TikTok ban. Considering the uncertainty surrounding the situation and the potential for Apple to be affected indirectly, the probability of the stock price rising or falling is difficult to determine with certainty. Given the context and previous predictions, a slight negative impact on Apple's stock price is possible due to the potential loss of app revenue.
Model: qwen/qwen-turbo, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.45, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.55, Reasoning: The financial news highlights Louis Navellier's positive view on Apple Inc., placing it among his top long-term stock picks. Navellier's reputation and track record lend credibility to his recommendations. Additionally, Apple's strong financial performance, AI innovations, and environmental initiatives suggest positive fundamentals. However, it currently ranks as the fifth pick in Navellier's list, possibly indicating that others might see higher potential in other stocks. Previous predictions suggest mixed sentiments, with a generally lower probability of stock price increase due to broader market sentiments and uncertainties.


Now give your prediction about the probability of the stock price of the relevant company rising or falling. Format your response in JSON format and include the following information as follows: 
{ 
"reasoning": "[Summarize your analysis and reasoning process here]", 
"company_name": "[Company Name indicating the name of the company]", 
"company_symbol": "[Company Symbol indicating the stock symbol of the company]", 
"news_headline": "[News Headline indicating the provided financial news headline]", 
"probability_of_stock_price_rise": [The estimated probability (a number between 0 and 1) that the stock price will rise due to this news], 
"probability_of_stock_price_fall": [The estimated probability (a number between 0 and 1) that the stock price will fall due to this news], 
} 
Do not generate output that isn't in properly formatted JSON.

```json
{
  "reasoning": "The news article discusses the World Economic Forum in Davos and its potential impact on various sectors, including technology, banking, retail, and crypto. While Apple Inc. (AAPL) is mentioned as part of the 'Magnificent 7,' the article does not provide specific information or developments directly related to Apple that would significantly influence its stock price. The broader market sentiment discussed (e.g., AI, tariffs, Fed policy) could have indirect effects, but without Apple-specific news, the impact is likely neutral. Previous predictions from other models also indicate a balanced view, with slight variations leaning towards a higher probability of a fall due to broader market uncertainties. Therefore, the probabilities of a rise or fall in Apple's stock price due to this news are balanced and low.",
  "company_name": "Apple Inc.",
  "company_symbol": "AAPL",
  "news_headline": "'Magnificent 7,' crypto, Trump coin, AI, Trump, tariffs, Fed, and everything else that will dominate Davos",
  "probability_of_stock_price_rise": 0.45,
  "probability_of_stock_price_fall": 0.45
}
```
